author: doudrop
title: Demystify Blockchain in LATAM
description: LATAMの金融規制当局は、暗号に関するネガティブなスティグマに惑わされ、ブロックチェーンを高リスクと結びつけてしまっています。

f6_assessments.q0:
It is not clear which key stakeholders the proposer says to work with. Therefore, I cannot know if this proposal will have any impact. And more, I really think that the "key financial regulators" needs more than some workshop to change ideas. 
Besides that, I do think that maybe this proposal would be better addressed in the "lobby" challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: No metrics/KPIs, no roadmap with milestones, no timetable, not a clear description of the stakeholders, not a clear description of which country to reach first, etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
The final objective is very noble and valid but I worry it might start from a wrong initial assumption in problem statement when it says regulators are misguided by negative stigmas. Sure, it can be one of the reasons there's a lack of regulation but there can be plenty of other reasons it can happen, especially when involving lobby from the current bank system that might lose profit with decentralized currencies (or other fiscal and monetary risks to governmentsa). In order to verify whether this problem statement (simple misguidance/lack of knowledge) is true, it would be nice to bring some evidence based on reasearches, articles, specialized papers, news and so on. The way it is written it seems to be just an assumption, which, in case not true, might compromise the whole project.
Having said that, and assumining the problem statement is true, I also see the solution, with 'short workshops', as way too simple to solve a problem this complex. It can surely help to decrease this negative stigma but not sure on the size of the impact considering the existing corpostatism and consolidated financial ecosystem.
I'd also make the scope a bit more clearer here. Is this project for all LATAM countries or only for some? If it is for all, I see the feasbility very unlikely. What is the expected outcome of this project? Just educate stakeholders or having some regulations kicked off?
f6_assessments.q1:
Very vague description on the team working on this projects. Theres no mention to how many people are involded or any links to their resume. It also says "combined direct exposure and networking with financial and regulatory key stakeholder" but theres no details on what exposure is that nor which stakeholders.
No clear plan or roadmap on how they intend to roll out this project (access key stakeholders as mentioned will require a lot of effort and planning as they are usually very importante people in their countries). 
Regarding the budget, not explained how it is going to be spent (though it says its non profitable).
Last, as mentioned in impact, it seems a very ambitious project to be rolled in a catalyst iniatiave, mainly due to the access of important people in the countries,  especially with no clear plan, team or budget breakdown. It promosses too much but the plan doesnt seem solid enough.
f6_assessments.q2:
No KPI or milestone mentioned. Final outcome of the idea not mentioned. As suggestions, Id measure the number of people in each country who were engaged by the workshops, the number of countries they were deployed and how many financial institutions were  impacted by it. 
Also, I see plenty of risks in this projects (initial assumptions wrong, not getting access to key stakeholders, not educating them properly, etc). A project like this needs to have a proper risk management process to overcome them.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and the solution to the problem are presented in a very vague manner. The problem identified is a false premise as the crypto market, taking into consideration just the high volatility of the price (in FIAT) of the assets, it is indeed a highly risky place for all participants experienced or not.

It is unclear what the statement "Intimate workshops with key stakeholders" means, maybe is just poor wording of something else, but the message is ambiguous.

From my understanding the proposal goal is to support a team of lobbyists that want to promote the benefits/features of Cardano ecosystem to the "the board of directors of the primary financial institutions, key members of the regulatory community, central bankers, and local exchanges directors."

This is an idealistic concept with no realistic chance to be successfully implemented as it is hard to believe that the target audience will accept the change of a centralized system very profitable for them with something decentralized.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal lacks in providing relevant details about the team that will implement the project, their roles and the experience they posses.

The budget is not broken down into identifiable items and there is no plan for implementation that shows what is being done and how nor the resources needed for the project.

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal itself reads very poorly. It reads like a concept more than an executable proposal. It needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. The target audience should be defined for a realistic perspective on the expected outcome.

Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are weakly described.

f6_assessments.q0: The goals of the proposal and the challenge are misaligned. The proposal aims to use community funds to educate key members of Latin American financial institutions, which may find their institutions obsolete in the wake of the blockchain revolution. The challenge goals are to "[...] raise awareness levels of regular people in Latin America about blockchain and the Cardano protocol [...]". I believe that using Catalyst community funds to educate small but powerful groups of financial institution stakeholders does not achieve the goal of the challenge and would struggle to meet the key metrics to measure the success of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind has a combined 50 years of experience working along side and networking with financial and regulatory key stakeholders in Latin America. Yet the team behind the proposal is unidentified, which casts ambiguity over the teams experience. The proposal has a well define focus for educating and demonstrating the capabilities and potential benefits of Cardano. Depending on the depth, scale, and target audience of the educational workshops the team should be able to successfully implement the proposal and achieve their goals of reducing the resistance to Cardano adoption within the financial sector.
f6_assessments.q2: In addition to the anonymous team, the proposal does not provide a timeline, budget breakdown, or other KPIs. This is concerning because the Catalyst community is not given a metrics to measure the progress of the proposal, nor does can it hold the team behind the proposal accountable for the success and failures of the project. It will be difficult for the community to audit the project and even more difficult to predict if the proposers will maintain transparency with the Catalyst community.

f6_assessments.q0: Educating regulators on Cardano is a good idea. I believe educating regulators will lessen the friction for adoption. The workshops will spread knowledge about Cardano and crypto and thus help to grow awareness in LATAM.
f6_assessments.q1: I would like to see links (LinkedIn or similar) to the relevant experienced mentioned in the proposal and an overview of the team leading the proposal. I would like to learn more about how the workshops will be designed to educate the regulators.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a single line budget and no roadmap, I would to see the team further breakdown the budget so we see where the funds will be spend. Furthermore, the team should develop a roadmap with milestones and KPIs (do 3 workshops by month 1, have 500 regulators attend by month 3, etc) The proposal talks about multiple workshops, is it $20k/$2k= 10 workshops? As the proposal stand at the moment I believe the proposal will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is actually really interesting because it targets country leaders and deciders. Educating the latin american leaders on blockchain would certainly have a huge impact on the global adoption. However, this proposal lacks some information that reduces its potential. The proposer should add key metrics and articulate how this project adds value to the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no clear path leading to the success of this project. In fact, the proposer needs to add some information that can significantly improve the feasibility of this proposal. The proposer should include evidence of relevance skills and experience. This can be achieved by adding linkedin profiles or other previous work done, similar to this one. The number of the team members needed to complete the work, should also be outlined in the proposal. Furthermore, if additional funding is needed, the proposer should have a plan for that. I will finish by suggesting to the proposer to consider challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal doesn't include a roadmap with milestones that can serve as reference to track the progress of this project. Adding to that the fact that KPIs are not included, makes it really difficult to audit this proposal. I suggest to the proposer to include those in the proposal. The improvement of this proposal can increase its chances of being funded in next rounds.

f6_assessments.q0:
I fully share the view of the proposer in the sense that a huge friction towards adoption of blochain technologies in Latam comes from a reputational issue with key decision makers (regulators, financial system, press, etc) the impact of overcoming this issue would be huge to grow Cardano in Latin America. 
It is a huge undertaking, it would be great to see detailed priorization in the proposal´s execution (which countries would be targeted and how)
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal strikes a great point but I missed details that help the community see how it would be implemented. Information on who the proposing team members are and what attributes they have to enable them to be successful whould greatly increase the chances of gaining the community's trust. 
I would have liked to see some KPI's and a commitment to report advance to the community as well as a detailed budget to justify the solicited funds.
Reaching key decition makers is never easy, I suggest explaining what risks the team can foresee that could frustrate a succesful execution.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe this proposal is hard to audit since no detailed timeline or KPIs are provided.

solution: 各金融センターの主要なステークホルダーとの親密なワークショップで、カルダノブロックチェーンがどのように経済活動を再構築できるかを教育／説明する。
experience: 私たちは、50年以上にわたり、ラテンアメリカの金融機関や規制当局の主要なステークホルダーと直接接し、ネットワークを築いてきました。
